description: Unknown. Perhaps a blend of stick +‎ cache or stow +‎ cache.

entries.meaning: (countable) A collection, sometimes hidden; a reserve.
examples: They had quite a stash of food saved up for emergencies.

entries.meaning: (countable, US, slang, informal, African-American Vernacular) A place where drugs are stored.
examples: The dealers managed to store the dope in the stash just in time to avoid being caught by the police.

entries.meaning: (uncountable, UK, slang) Clothing or other items branded with a particular university club or society's logo.
examples: We've now ordered stash for everyone who said they wanted some.

entries.meaning: (countable, textiles) A collection of yarn or other materials not yet allocated to any particular craft project.
examples: My stash is mostly unfinished objects on the needles. I have one bag of yarn that I bought to make a coat.

verbs.description: stash (third-person singular simple present stashes, present participle stashing, simple past and past participle stashed)

entries.meaning: To hide or store away for later use.
examples: He stashed his liquor in the cabinet under the bar.
